prior_works.title: Differentially Private Synthetic Data via Foundation Model APIs
prior_works.authors: Zinan Lin, Chulin Xie, Arturs Backurs, Sivakanth Gopi, Da Yu, Huseyin A. Inan, Harsha Nori, Haotian Jiang, Huishuai Zhang, Yin Tat Lee, Bo Li, Sergey Yekhanin
prior_works.role: Algorithmic precursor introducing Private Evolution (PE) for images with only black-box API access
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Aug-PE is a direct extension of PE, adapting its DP propose–score–select evolutionary loop from diffusion models for images to LLM-based text generation with text-specific utilities and augmentations.

prior_works.title: Mechanism Design via Differential Privacy (Exponential Mechanism)
prior_works.role: Foundational DP selection mechanism for choosing high-utility items under privacy
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Aug-PE’s private best-of-N selection among LLM-generated candidates relies on exponential-mechanism-style/noisy-argmax selection to pick high-utility texts while preserving DP.

prior_works.title: Deep Learning with Differential Privacy
prior_works.authors: Martín Abadi, Andy Chu, Ian Goodfellow, H. Brendan McMahan, Ilya Mironov, Kunal Talwar, Li Zhang
prior_works.role: Baseline DP-SGD approach and accounting principles that Aug-PE aims to avoid for proprietary LLMs
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper’s motivation and comparisons build on DP-SGD, highlighting Aug-PE’s advantage of avoiding costly DP fine-tuning while still providing formal DP guarantees.

prior_works.title: Rényi Differential Privacy
prior_works.role: Tight privacy accounting/composition for iterative DP mechanisms
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Aug-PE composes many private selection and scoring steps, for which RDP-style accounting provides tighter cumulative privacy bounds.

prior_works.title: Evolution Strategies as a Scalable Alternative to Reinforcement Learning
prior_works.authors: Tim Salimans, Jonathan Ho, Xi Chen, Szymon Sidor, Ilya Sutskever
prior_works.role: Black-box optimization via sample–mutate–select that underpins PE’s evolutionary search
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The generate–perturb–select paradigm from evolution strategies informs Aug-PE’s black-box search over LLM outputs without accessing or training model parameters.

prior_works.title: Semi-supervised Knowledge Transfer for Deep Learning from Private Training Data (PATE)
prior_works.authors: Nicolas Papernot, Martín Abadi, Úlfar Erlingsson, Ian Goodfellow, Kunal Talwar
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Aug-PE’s use of noisy selection/aggregation over multiple candidates echoes PATE’s DP noisy-argmax principle for privatizing decisions based on sensitive data.

prior_works.title: PATE-GAN: Generating Synthetic Data with Differential Privacy
prior_works.authors: James Jordon, Jinsung Yoon, Mihaela van der Schaar
prior_works.role: DP-guided generative data synthesis via private selection/aggregation
prior_works.relationship_sentence: PATE-GAN demonstrates how DP selection can steer generative models, a strategy Aug-PE adopts in a black-box LLM setting by privately selecting among sampled texts.

synthesis_narrative: The paper’s core contribution—Aug-PE for differentially private synthetic text via LLM APIs—sits at the intersection of black-box evolutionary generation and rigorous DP selection/accounting. It builds directly on Private Evolution (Lin et al., 2024), which introduced a DP propose–score–select loop using only API access to foundation models; Aug-PE adapts this template from images to the harder text domain by defining text-specific utilities, augmentations, and iteration schemes. The selection step is grounded in the exponential mechanism (McSherry & Talwar, 2007), enabling private best-of-N choice among LLM samples based on utilities computed against sensitive corpora. Because Aug-PE repeats private scoring/selection many times, it relies on tight composition—conveniently handled by Rényi Differential Privacy (Mironov, 2017)—to maintain end-to-end guarantees. The black-box optimization flavor of Aug-PE echoes evolution strategies (Salimans et al., 2017), which inspire the generate–mutate–select procedure without accessing model internals. On the generative privacy side, PATE (Papernot et al., 2017) and PATE-GAN (Jordon et al., 2019) established that noisy aggregation/selection can safely guide model outputs, a principle Aug-PE applies to rerank LLM candidates using DP noise. Finally, Abadi et al. (2016) provide the canonical DP-SGD baseline and conceptual backdrop—highlighting the cost and impracticality of DP fine-tuning proprietary LLMs that Aug-PE circumvents while still delivering formal DP guarantees for synthetic text.
